bug.author: EricThomson
bug.summary: Error when applying snowflake to image
bug.description:
I have a greyscale image (image.shape returns (330,228) with dtype uint8). I try the following: <denchmark-code>snowflakes = iaa.Snowflakes(flake_size = (0.1, 0.4), speed = (0.01, 0.05)) image_sf = snowflakes.augment_image(image) </denchmark-code>
And receive the following error with the second line:
File "", line 1, in image_sf = snowflakes.augment_image(image) File "/home/eric/miniconda3/envs/auger/lib/python3.7/site-packages/imgaug/augmenters/meta.py", line 470, in augment_image return self.augment_images([image], hooks=hooks)[0] File "/home/eric/miniconda3/envs/auger/lib/python3.7/site-packages/imgaug/augmenters/meta.py", line 639, in augment_images images_result[i] = np.squeeze(images_result[i], axis=2) File "/home/eric/miniconda3/envs/auger/lib/python3.7/site-packages/numpy/core/fromnumeric.py", line 1388, in squeeze return squeeze(axis=axis) ValueError: cannot select an axis to squeeze out which has size not equal to one
I am in Python 3.7, imgaug 0.2.9, Ubuntu 18. The other augmenters I have tried have worked fine on the image (e.g., GaussianBlur, MotionBlur, Affine, CoarseDropout).

comments.comment: This should now be fixed in master. Thanks for reporting it!
